content.description: This problem deals with functions defined by f(x) = x + b sin x , where b is a positive constant and −2π ≤ x ≤ 2π .
content.question: Find the x-coordinates of all points, −2π ≤ x ≤ 2π, where the line y = x + b is tangent to the graph of f(x) = x + b sin x.

frqParts.text: Find the x-coordinates of all points, −2π ≤ x ≤ 2π, where the line y = x + b is tangent to the graph of f(x) = x + b sin x.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
